info.description: API documentation for Branch Management Tool.
info.title: Branch Management Tool API

get.description: Retrieve a list of system audit logs with pagination
Retrieve details for a specific audit log entry

post.description: Test if a remote git URL is accessible.

get.description: Get a list of all registered repositories in the system.

post.description: Register a new git repository by path. If the repository does not exist in the database, it will be added.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid input or path

post.description: Clone a remote git repository to a local path asynchronously. Returns a task ID to track progress.

400.description: Bad Request - Directory exists or invalid input

post.description: Scan a local directory to check if it's a valid git repository and retrieve its configuration.

get.description: List all tags in the repository

post.description: Create a tag on a specific branch or commit, optionally push to remote

get.description: Get version string based on git describe
Get suggestions for next major, minor, and patch versions
List all versions (tags)
Get details of a specific repository by its unique key.

delete.description: Delete a repository from the system. This does not delete the files from disk, only the registration.

400.description: Cannot delete if used in sync tasks

get.description: List branches for a repository with pagination and filtering. Includes ahead/behind sync status if available.

put.description: Rename a branch or update its description.

post.description: Switch the working tree to the specified branch.
Pull changes from the configured upstream remote for a specific branch.

400.description: Bad Request - No upstream or not current branch

get.description: Compare two branches and return diff statistics and file list.
Get the raw diff content between two branches, optionally for a specific file.

post.description: Fetch updates from all configured remotes.
post.summary: Fetch all remotes for a repository

get.summary: Get effective git config (user.name, user.email) for the repo

get.description: Perform a dry run of a merge to check for conflicts without modifying the repository.
get.summary: Dry run merge to check conflicts

200.description: Success status, does not mean no conflict, check data

get.description: Get the output of 'git status' for the repository.

post.description: Stage all changes, commit them with a message, and optionally push to remote.

get.description: Analyze code statistics (author contributions, file types, etc.) for a branch.
get.summary: Get code statistics for a branch

parameters.description: Filter by Author Name or Email
parameters.name: author

get.description: List branches for statistics (simplified list).

get.summary: Get commit history for a branch

get.description: Get the history of sync executions, optionally filtered by repository.

post.description: Manually trigger a configured sync task to run immediately.

get.description: List all sync tasks, optionally filtered by repository key.
get.summary: List sync tasks for a repo

post.description: Create a new automated synchronization task between two repositories or branches.

get.description: Get details of a specific sync task by its unique key.

put.description: Update configuration of an existing sync task.

get.description: List public SSH keys available in the user's home .ssh directory.
Get the status and logs of a background clone task.

name.description: Removed binding:"required" as hertz might handle it differently or I'll validate manually

push_remote.description: Optional: Remote name to push to

remotes.description: Optional list of remotes to sync

desc.description: Description is not native to git branch, maybe store in config or ignore for now? Requirement said "Modify branch name and description". Git doesn't strictly support branch description except via `git branch --edit-description` which opens an editor. `git config branch.<name>.description` works.
